sen.j: 鞍馬寺（くらまでら）は、京都府京都市左京区鞍馬本町にある仏教寺院。
sen.e: Kurama Temple is a buddhist temple located in Kurama Honmachi, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kurama-dera Temple is a buddhist temple located in Kurama Honmachi, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kurama-dera Temple is a buddhist temple located in Kurama Honmachi, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 宗派はもと天台宗に属したが、1949年以降独立して鞍馬弘教総本山となっている。
sen.e: Used to belong to Tendai Sect but became independent from Year 1949 onwards and is now the Head Temple of Kurama-kokyo Sect.
It used to belong to Tendai Sect, but since 1949 it became independent and is now the Head Temple of Kurama-kokyo Sect.
It used to belong to Tendai Sect, but since 1949 it became independent and is now the Head Temple of Kurama-kokyo Sect.

sen.j: 山号は鞍馬山。
sen.e: Sango is Mount Kurama.
Sango is Mount Kurama.
Sango is Mount Kurama.

sen.j: 開基（創立者）は、鑑真の高弟鑑禎（がんてい）とされている。
sen.e: The person who established this temple is said to be Gantei, a leading disciple of Ganjin.
It is said to have been established by Gantei, a leading disciple of Ganjin.
It is said to have been established by Gantei, a leading disciple of Ganjin.

sen.j: 本尊は寺では「尊天」と称している。
sen.e: In this temple, the Honzon is referred to as "Sonten".
In this temple, the Honzon (main image of worship) is referred to as "Sonten".
sen.cmt: 本尊の説明に main image of worship と付け足し
sen.e: In this temple, the Honzon (main image of worship) is referred to as "Sonten."

sen.j: 「尊天」とは、毘沙門天、千手観音、護法魔王尊の三身一体の本尊であるという。
sen.e: "Sonten" is said to be the Honzon of a Trinity of Vaisravana, saharabhuja and Goho Maoson.
"Sonten" is said to be the Honzon that is a Trinity of Vaisravana, Saharabhuja and Goho Maoson.
"Sonten" is said to be the Honzon that is a Trinity of Vaisravana, Saharabhuja and Goho Maoson.

sen.j: 京都盆地の北に位置し、豊かな自然環境を残す鞍馬山の南斜面に位置する。
sen.e: Is located at north of Kyoto Basin, at the sourthern slope of Mount Kurama, where rich natural environment remain.
Is located at the north of Kyoto Basin, on the sourthern slope of Mount Kurama, where rich natural environment remains.
Is located at the north of Kyoto Basin, on the sourthern slope of Mount Kurama, where rich natural environment remains.

sen.j: 鞍馬は牛若丸（源義経）が修行をした地として著名であり、大佛次郎の『鞍馬天狗』でも知られる。
sen.e: Kurama is also famous as the place where Ushiwakamaru (MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune) trained himself, and also as the place where Jiro OSARAGI set his book, "Kurama Tengu".
Kurama is also famous as the place where Ushiwakamaru (MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune) trained himself, and it is also known as the setting for Jiro OSARAGI's book, "Kurama Tengu".
Kurama is also famous as the place where Ushiwakamaru (MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune) trained himself, and it is also known as the setting for Jiro OSARAGI's book, "Kurama Tengu."

sen.j: 新西国十九番札所である。
sen.e: Is the No. 19 New Saigoku Kannon Pilgrimage Site.
sen.cmt: 番なので No. を入れ、Site を単数に。
sen.e: It is the No. 19 New Saigoku Kannon Pilgrimage Site.
sen.cmt: 主語追加； It is New Saigoku Kannon Pilgrimage Site No. 19 又は It is Site No. 19 of New Saigoku Kannon Pilgrimage の方がいいかもしれません。
sen.e: It is the No. 19 New Saigoku Kannon Pilgrimage Site.

sen.j: なお、鞍馬寺への輸送機関としてケーブルカー（鞍馬山鋼索鉄道）を運営しており、宗教法人としては唯一の鉄道事業者ともなっている。
sen.e: Operates cable car (Mount Kurama Cable Railway) as transportation to Kurama Temple, and is the only religious corporation which operates railway business.
It operates a cable car (Mount Kurama Cable Railway) transportation to Kurama Temple, and it is the only religious corporation which operates a railway business.
It operates a cable car (Mount Kurama Cable Railway) transportation to Kurama Temple, and it is the only religious corporation which operates a railway business.

sen.j: 鞍馬寺の草創については、『今昔物語集』、『扶桑略記』など諸書に見られ、延暦15年（796年）、藤原南家の出身で造東寺長官を務めた藤原伊勢人という人物が毘沙門天と千手観音を安置して創建したとされている。
sen.e: Various books including "Konjaku Monogatarishu" and "Fusoryakuki" describe the beginning of Kurama Temple, and it is said that a person named FUJIWARA no Isendo, who came from Fujiwara Nanke and served as the Head of Zoto-ji Temple, enshrined Vaisravana and sahasrabhuja, and built Kurama Temple.

Various books including "Konjaku Monogatarishu" and "Fusoryakuki" describe the beginning of Kurama Temple, and it is said that a person named FUJIWARA no Isendo, who came from Fujiwara Nanke and served as the Head of Zoto-ji Temple, enshrined Vaisravana and sahasrabhuja, and built Kurama Temple.

Various books including "Konjaku Monogatarishu" and "Fusoryakuki" describe the beginning of Kurama Temple, and it is said that a person named FUJIWARA no Isendo, who came from Fujiwara Nanke and served as the Head of Zoto-ji Temple, enshrined Vaisravana and sahasrabhuja, and built Kurama Temple.

sen.j: しかし、寺に伝わる『鞍馬蓋寺縁起』（あんばがいじえんぎ）には別の草創縁起を伝えており、鑑真の高弟鑑禎（がんてい）が宝亀元年（770年）に草庵を結び、毘沙門天を安置したのが始まりという。
sen.e: However, "Anbagaiji engi", handed down for many generations in the temple, tells another story about the start of the temple, which is that Gantei, a high disciple of Ganjin, built a cottage in the 1st Year of Hoki, and enshrined Vaisravana.

However, "Anbagaiji engi", handed down for many generations in the temple, tells another story about the start of the temple, which is that Gantei, a high disciple of Ganjin, built a cottage in the 1st Year of Hoki, and enshrined Vaisravana.

However, "Anbagaiji engi", handed down for many generations in the temple, tells another story about the start of the temple, which is that Gantei, a high disciple of Ganjin, built a cottage in the 1st Year of Hoki, and enshrined Vaisravana.

sen.j: 鑑禎は、鑑真が唐から伴ってきた高弟8名のうちの最年少であった。
sen.e: Gantei was the youngest among the 6 high disciples who Ganjin brought back with him from Tang.
Gantei was the youngest among the eight high disciples who Ganjin brought back with him from Tang (present day China).
sen.cmt: 原文は高弟８名となってます。必要ないかもしれませんが、唐は現在の中国であることを書いておくといいのでは？
sen.e: Gantei was the youngest among the eight high disciples who Ganjin brought back with him from Tang (present day China).

sen.j: 宝亀3年（772年）のある夜、鑑禎は霊夢を見、山城国の北方に霊山があると告げられる。
sen.e: One night on 3rd year of Hoki, Gantei saw a spiritual dream, which told him that there is a spiritual mountain in the north of Yamashiro Province.
One night, in the third year of Hoki, Gantei saw a spiritual dream, which told him that there is a spiritual mountain in the north of Yamashiro Province.
One night, in the third year of Hoki, Gantei saw a spiritual dream, which told him that there is a spiritual mountain in the north of Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 霊山を尋ねて出かけた鑑禎は、ある山の上方に宝の鞍を乗せた白馬の姿を見る。
sen.e: Gantei, who set off to visit the spiritual mountain, saw a white horse with a saddle made by treasures on top of a mountain.
Gantei, who set off to visit the spiritual mountain, saw a white horse with a saddle made by treasures on top of a mountain.
Gantei, who set off to visit the spiritual mountain, saw a white horse with a saddle made by treasures on top of a mountain.

sen.j: その山が鞍馬山であった。
sen.e: That was Mount Kurama.
That was Mount Kurama.
That was Mount Kurama.

sen.j: 山に入った鑑禎は女形の鬼に襲われ殺されそうになるが、あわやという時、枯れ木が倒れてきて鬼はつぶされてしまった。
sen.e: Gantei, on entering the mountain, was attacked and nearly killed by an ogre who took the form of a woman, but when he was in extreme danger, a dead tree fell down, and crushed the ogre.
Gantei, on entering the mountain, was attacked and nearly killed by an ogre who took the form of a woman, but when he was in extreme danger, a dead tree fell down and crushed the ogre.
Gantei, on entering the mountain, was attacked and nearly killed by an ogre who took the form of a woman, but when he was in extreme danger, a dead tree fell down and crushed the ogre.

sen.j: 翌朝になると、そこには毘沙門天の像があったので、鑑禎はこれを祀る一寺を建立したという。
sen.e: Next morning, a statue of Vaisravana was there, and it is said that Gantei built a temple to worship this statue.
The next morning, a statue of Vaisravana was there, and it is said that Gantei built a temple to worship this statue.
The next morning, a statue of Vaisravana was there, and it is said that Gantei built a temple to worship this statue.

sen.j: この鑑禎の話は『鞍馬蓋寺縁起』以外の書物には見えず、どこまで史実を伝えるものかわからない。
sen.e: This story about Gantei is only seen in "Anbagaiji engi", and it is not clear how far it tells an actual histroical event.
This story about Gantei is only seen in "Anbagaiji engi", and it is not clear how far it tells an actual histroical event.
This story about Gantei is only seen in "Anbagaiji engi", and it is not clear how far it tells an actual historical event.

sen.j: ただし、清水寺の草創縁起と同様、南都（奈良）の僧が創建にかかわったとしている点は注目される。
sen.e: Nevertheless, it is notable that a priest of South Capital (Nara) took part in establishment of the temple, similarly to the case of establishment of Kiyomizu Temple.
Nevertheless, it is notable that a priest of South Capital (Nara) took part in establishing the temple, as in the case of the establishment of Kiyomizu Temple.
Nevertheless, it is notable that a priest of South Capital (Nara) took part in establishing the temple, as in the case of the establishment of KiyomizuTemple.

sen.j: その後、延暦15年（796年）、官寺である東寺の建設主任であった藤原伊勢人は、自分の個人的に信仰する観音を祀る寺を建てたいと考えていた。
sen.e: Later on, in Year 796, FUJIWARA no Isendo, who was in charge of building To-ji Temple, an official temple, wished to build a temple to place a Kannon that he personally worships.
Later, in 796, FUJIWARA no Isendo, who was in charge of building an official temple, To-ji Temple, wished to build a temple to place a Kannon that he personally worshiped.
Later, in 796, FUJIWARA no Isendo, who was in charge of building an official temple, To-ji Temple, wished to build a temple to place a Kannon that he personally worshiped.

sen.j: 伊勢人は、ある夜見た霊夢のお告げにしたがい、白馬の後を追って鞍馬山に着くと、そこには毘沙門天を祀る小堂があった。
sen.e: Isendo, following a message given in a spiritual dream that he saw one night, arrived at Mount Kurama following a white horse, where he sall a small shrine whichi worshipped Vaisravana.
Isendo, in accordance with a message revealed to him in a spiritual dream one night, followed a white horse and arrived at Mount Kurama, upon which he saw a small shrine that housed Vaisravana.
Isendo, in accordance with a message revealed to him in a spiritual dream one night, followed a white horse and arrived at Mount Kurama, upon which he saw a small shrine that housed Vaisravana.

sen.j: 「自分は観音を信仰しているのに、ここに祀られているのは毘沙門天ではないか」と伊勢人はいぶかしがった。
sen.e: Isendo was doubtful that "although I worship Kannon, it is Vaisravana that is worshipped here".
Isendo became suspicious saying, "I worship Kannon, but it is Vaisravana that is worshipped here."
Isendo became suspicious saying, "I worship Kannon, but it is Vaisravana that is worshipped here."

sen.j: ところが、その晩の夢に1人の童子が現われ、「観音も毘沙門天も名前が違うだけで、実はもともと1つのものなのだ」と告げた。
sen.e: However, in his dreams that night, a child appeared and told him that "Kannon and Vaisravana have different names, but they are initially one and the same".
However, in his dream that night, a child appeared and told him that "Kannon and Vaisravana have different names, but fundamentally they are one and the same".
sen.cmt: 原文の「もともと」は最初という意味よりも根本的にという意味があるような気がするので fundamentally にしました。
sen.e: However, in his dream that night, a child appeared and told him that "Kannon and Vaisravana have different names, but fundamentally they are one and the same."

sen.j: こうして伊勢人は千手観音の像をつくって、毘沙門天とともに安置したという。
sen.e: Thus it is said that Isendo made a statue of sahasrabhuja and enshrined it together with Vaisravana.
Thus it is said that Isendo made a statue of sahasrabhuja and enshrined it together with Vaisravana.
Thus it is said that Isendo made a statue of sahasrabhuja and enshrined it together with Vaisravana.

sen.j: 9世紀末の寛平年間（889年 - 897年）東寺の僧・峯延（ぶえん）が入寺したころから、鞍馬寺は真言宗寺院となるが、12世紀には天台宗に改宗し、以後の鞍馬寺は長く青蓮院の支配下にあった。
sen.e: Kurama Temple became a temple of Shingon Sect from around the time of Kanpyo era (Year 889 to 897) at the end of the 9th Century, when Priest Buen of To-ji Temple entered Kurama Temple, but changed to Tendai Sect in 12th Century, and since then has been under the control of Shoren in for a long time.

Kurama-dera Temple became a temple of Shingon Sect from around the time when Priest Buen of To-ji Temple entered Kurama Temple during Kanpyo era (from 889 to 897) at the end of the 9th Century, but it changed to Tendai Sect in the 12th Century; since thenit has been under the control of Shoren-in for a long time.

Kurama-dera Temple became a temple of Shingon Sect from around the time when Priest Buen of To-ji Temple entered Kurama Temple during Kanpyo era (from 889 to 897) at the end of the 9th Century, but it changed to Tendai Sect in the 12th Century; since then it has been under the control of Shoren-in for a long time.

sen.j: 寛治5年（1091年）には白河天皇が参詣、承徳3年（1099年）には関白藤原師通が参詣するなど、平安時代後期には広く信仰を集めていたようである。
sen.e: Seems to have been worshipped by many people in the latter half of Heian period, as can seen by the fact that Emperor Shirakawa came to worship in Year 1091 and Moromichi FUJIWARA, the Kanpaku, in Year 1099.

It appears to have attracted worshippers widely during the latter half of Heian period, as can seen by the fact that Emperor Shirakawa came to worship in 1091 and Moromichi FUJIWARA, the Kanpaku, in 1099.

It appears to have attracted worshippers widely during the latter half of Heian period, as can seen by the fact that Emperor Shirakawa came to worship in 1091 and Moromichi FUJIWARA, the Kanpaku, in 1099.

sen.j: 『枕草子』は「近うて遠きもの」の例として鞍馬寺の九十九（つづら）折りの参道を挙げている。
sen.e: "The Pillow Book" names the Front Approach of Ninety-nine Prayers of Kurama Temple, as an example of "something which is near but also far".
"The Pillow Book" names the Front Approach of Ninety-nine Prayers of Kurama Temple as an example of "something which is near but also far".
"The Pillow Book" names the Front Approach of Ninety-nine Prayers of Kurama Temple as an example of "something which is near but also far".

sen.j: 鞍馬寺は大治元年（1126年）の火災をはじめとして、たびたび焼失している。
sen.e: Kurama Temple has been burned down many times, including by the fire of Year 1126.
Kurama Temple has been burned down many times, including by the fire of Year 1126.
Kurama Temple has been burned down many times, including by the fire of Year 1126.

sen.j: 江戸時代の文化 (元号)9年（1812年）には一山炎上する大火災があり、近代に入って1945年（昭和20年）にも本殿などが焼失している。
sen.e: In Year 1812 of Edo period, the whole mountain was in flames by a great fire, and more recently, the Main Shrine was lost by a fire in Year 1945.
In 1812 (nineth year of Bunka of Edo period), there was a great fire that engulfed the whole mountain in flames, and more recently, the Main Shrine was burned down by a fire in Year 1945.
In 1812 (ninth year of Bunka of Edo period), there was a great fire that engulfed the whole mountain in flames, and more recently, the Main Shrine was burned down by a fire in Year 1945.

sen.j: このため、堂宇はいずれも新しいものだが、仏像などの文化財は豊富に伝えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, all letters written in the temple are new, but many cultural properties such as statues of the Buddha have been handed down generation to generation.
sen.cmt: 堂字がまったく検索にひっかからず、何のことがはっきりわからない。
sen.e: Therefore, all the buildings are new, but many cultural properties such as statues of the Buddha have been preserved.
sen.cmt: 「堂字（どうじ）」ではなく「堂宇（どうう）」、お堂や殿堂という意味です。
sen.e: Therefore, all the buildings are new, but many cultural properties such as statues of the Buddha have been preserved.

sen.j: 昭和期の住職・信楽香雲（しがらきこううん）は、1947年に鞍馬弘教を開宗。
sen.e: Koun SHIGARAKI, a chief priest in the Showa era, started Kurama-kokyo Sect in Year 1947.
Koun SHIGARAKI, a chief priest in the Showa era, started Kurama-kokyo Sect in 1947.
Koun SHIGARAKI, a chief priest in the Showa era, started Kurama-kokyo Sect in 1947.

sen.j: 1949年には天台宗から独立して鞍馬弘教総本山となっている。
sen.e: In Year 1949 the temple became independent from Tendai Sect and is now the Head Temple of Kurama-kokyo Sect.
In 1949 the temple became independent from Tendai Sect and is now the Head Temple of Kurama-kokyo Sect.
In 1949 the temple became independent from Tendai Sect and is now the Head Temple of Kurama-kokyo Sect.

sen.j: 京都の奥にある鞍馬山は山岳信仰、山伏による密教も盛んであった。
sen.e: In Mount Kurama, located in the inner part of Kyoto, mountain ascetic hermits actively practiced Vajrayana Buddhism.
In Mount Kurama, located in the mountains of Kyoto, mountain ascetic hermits actively practiced Vajrayana Buddhism.
sen.cmt: "inner part of Kyoto"だと京都（市）の中心方面に感じるので、山の方（京都府の中心方面という意味での奥）と訳しました。
sen.e: In Mount Kurama, located in the mountains of Kyoto, mountain ascetic hermits actively practiced Vajrayana Buddhism.

sen.j: そのため山の精霊である天狗もまた鞍馬に住むと言われる。
sen.e: Therefore, it is said that Tengus, who are spirits of the mountains, live in Kurama.
Therefore, it is said that Tengus, who are spirits of the mountains, live in Kurama.
Therefore, it is said that Tengus, who are spirits of the mountains, live in Kurama.

sen.j: 鞍馬に住む大天狗は僧正坊と呼ばれる最高位のものでありまた鞍馬山は天狗にとって最高位の山のひとつであるとされる。
sen.e: The most high-ranking Tengu called Sojobo lived in Kurama, and Mount Kurama is said to be one of the most high-ranking mountains for a Tengu.
The higest-ranking Tengu that lives in Kurama is called Sojobo, and Mount Kurama is said to be one of the most supreme mountains for Tengu.
The highest-ranking Tengu that lives in Kurama is called Sojobo, and Mount Kurama is said to be one of the most supreme mountains for Tengu.

sen.j: 京都の北に位置する鞍馬寺は、もともと毘沙門天（四天王のうち北方を守護する）を本尊とする寺院であり、併せて千手観世音と護法魔王尊を祀った寺院であった。
sen.e: Kurama Temple, located in north of Kyoto, was initially a temple with Vaisravana(of the Four Heavenly Kings, the King protecting the north-side) as its Honzon, and also worshipped saharabhuja and Goho Maoson.

Kurama-dera Temple, located north of Kyoto, was initially a temple with Vaisravana (of the Four Heavenly Kings, the King protecting the north-side) as its Honzon, and it also enshrined Saharabhuja and Goho Maoson.
sen.cmt: dera 追加；祀るを enshrine に変更
sen.e: Kurama-dera Temple, located north of Kyoto, was initially a temple with Vaisravana (of the Four Heavenly Kings, the King protecting the north-side) as its Honzon, and it also enshrined Saharabhuja and Goho Maoson.

sen.j: しかし、鞍馬弘教立教後の現在の鞍馬寺の信仰形態は独特のもので、本尊についても若干の説明を要する。
sen.e: However, the form of religion of the current Kurama Temple after establishment of Kurama-kokyo is unique, and some explanation is neccesary regarding its Honzon.
However, form of worship at the current Kurama Temple after the establishment of Kurama-kokyo is unique, and some explanation is neccesary regarding its Honzon.
sen.cmt: religion を worship に変更
sen.e: However, form of worship at the current Kurama Temple after the establishment of Kurama-kokyo is unique, and some explanation is necessary regarding its Honzon.

sen.j: 鞍馬弘教立教後の寺の説明によると、鞍馬寺本殿金堂（本堂）の本尊は「尊天」であるとされる。
sen.e: According to the explanation by the temple after establishment of Kurama-kokyo, the Honzon of Kurama Temple Main Shrine Golden Hall (the Main Shrine) is said to be "Sonten".
According to the explanation by the temple after the establishment of Kurama-kokyo, the Honzon of Kurama Temple Main Shrine Golden Hall (the Main Shrine) is said to be "Sonten".
According to the explanation by the temple after the establishment of Kurama-kokyo, the Honzon of Kurama Temple Main Shrine Golden Hall (the Main Shrine) is said to be "Sonten."

sen.j: 堂内には中央に毘沙門天、向かって右に千手観世音、左には護法魔王尊が安置され、これらの三身を一体として「尊天」と称している。
sen.e: Within the shrine, Vaisravana is enshrined in the center, saharabhuja is on the right side facing it, and Goho Maoson on the left side, and the three are collectively referred to as "Sonten".
Within the shrine, Vaisravana is enshrined in the center, Saharabhuja is on the right side facing it, and Goho Maoson on the left side, and the three are collectively referred to as "Sonten".
sen.cmt: saharabhuja のｓは大文字を使って Saharabhuja？
sen.e: Within the shrine, Vaisravana is enshrined in the center, Saharabhuja is on the right side facing it, and Goho Maoson on the left side, and the three are collectively referred to as "Sonten."

sen.j: 「尊天」とは「すべての生命の生かし存在させる宇宙エネルギー」であるとする。
sen.e: "Sonten" is said to be "the space energy which makes all living things alive and existing".
"Sonten" is said to be "the cosmic energy that gives lfe and existence".
"Sonten" is said to be "the cosmic energy that gives lfe and existence."

sen.j: また、毘沙門天を「光」の象徴にして「太陽の精霊」・千手観世音を「愛」の象徴にして「月輪の精霊」・魔王尊を「力」の象徴にして「大地（地球）の霊王」としている。
sen.e: Also, Vaisravana as the symbol of "Light", and saharabhuja, the Sprit of Sunlight as the symbol of "Love", and Maoson, the Spirit of Moonlight as the symbol of "Power", are referred to as Spiritual Kings of Earth.
sen.cmt: 3体なので king を kings とした。
sen.e: Moreover, Vaisravana represents the Spirit of Sunlight that symbolizes "Light", Saharabhujarepresents the Sprit of Moonlight that symbolizes "Love", and Maoson represents the Spiritual King of Earth that symbolizes "Power".
sen.cmt: trans1 が原文と少しずれてるようなので直しました。
sen.e: Moreover, Vaisravana represents the Spirit of Sunlight that symbolizes "Light" Saharabhujarepresents the Sprit of Moonlight that symbolizes "Love", and Maoson represents the Spiritual King of Earth that symbolizes "Power."

sen.j: 鞍馬寺とは、どこにでも存在する「尊天」のパワーが特に多い場所にして、そのパワーに包まれるための道場であるとしている。
sen.e: Kurama Temple is said to be a place where the power of "Sonten", which exists everywhere, is especially strong, and the place of practice to be surrounded by such power.

The power of "Sonten" is believed to exist everywhere, and since this power is especially strong in this area Kurama-dera Temple is said to be a place of practice where one can be surrounded by such power.
sen.cmt: 読みやすいように書き直しました。
sen.e: The power of "Sonten" is believed to exist everywhere, and since this power is especially strong in this area Kurama-dera Temple is said to be a place of practice where one can be surrounded by such power.

sen.j: 「尊天」のひとり、「護法魔王尊」とは、650万年前（「650年」の間違いではない）、金星から地球に降り立ったもので、その体は通常の人間とは異なる元素から成り、その年齢は16歳のまま、年をとることのない永遠の存在であるという。
sen.e: Goho Maoson, one of the Sonten, came to Earth from Venus 6.5 million years ago (not "650 years" ago), and its body is formed from elements different from those of human beings, and it is said to be an eternal figure which does not grow older from the age of 16.

It is said that Goho Maoson, one of the Sonten, came to Earth from Venus 6.5 million years ago (not "650 years" ago); its body is formed from elements different from those ordinary human beings, and it is said to be in an eternal existence at the age of 16 and it does not age.

It is said that Goho Maoson, one of the Sonten, came to Earth from Venus 6.5 million years ago (not "650 years" ago); its body is formed from elements different from those ordinary human beings, and it is said to be in an eternal existence at the age of 16 and it does not age.

sen.j: 本殿金堂の毘沙門天・千手観世音・護法魔王尊はいずれも秘仏であるが、秘仏厨子の前に「お前立ち」と称する代わりの像が安置されている。
sen.e: Vaisravana, saharabhuja and Goho Maoson that are enshrined in Golden Hall of the Main Shrine are all secret Buddha statues, and in front of the secret Buddha Statues, statues representing them, referred to as "Omae-dachi", are enshrined.

Vaisravana, Saharabhuja and Goho Maoson that are enshrined in Golden Hall of the Main Shrine are all secret Buddha statues [not open for public viewing]; in their stead statues referred to as "Omae-dachi" are enshrined in front of these secret Buddha Statues.
sen.cmt: 秘仏とは一般公開してないものという意味を付け加えました
sen.e: Vaisravana, Saharabhuja and Goho Maoson that are enshrined in Golden Hall of the Main Shrine are all secret Buddha statues [not open for public viewing]; in their stead statues referred to as "Omae-dachi" are enshrined in front of these secret Buddha Statues.

sen.j: お前立ちの魔王尊像は、背中に羽根をもち、長いひげをたくわえた仙人のような姿で、鼻が高い。
sen.e: Omae-dachi Maoson statue looks like an unwordly person, with wings on its back, and a long beard, and has a high nose.
Omae-dachi Maoson statue looks like an unwordly person, with wings on its back, and a long beard, and has a high nose.
Omae-dachi Maoson statue looks like an unworldly person, with wings on its back, and a long beard, and has a high nose.

sen.j: 光背は木の葉でできている。
sen.e: The aureola is made from tree leaves.
The aureola is made from tree leaves.
The aureola is made from tree leaves.

sen.j: 多宝塔に安置の護法魔王尊像も同じような姿をしている。
sen.e: Goho Maoson enshrined in Two-storied pagota has a similar form.
Goho Maoson enshrined in Two-storied pagota has a similar form.
Goho Maoson enshrined in Two-storied pagoda has a similar form.

sen.j: このことから「鞍馬天狗」とはもともと護法魔王尊であったと思われる。
sen.e: Therefore, it is believed that "Kurama Tengu" was initially Goho Maoson.
Therefore, it is believed that "Kurama Tengu" was initially Goho Maoson.
Therefore, it is believed that "Kurama Tengu" was initially Goho Maoson.

sen.j: また、16歳とされているわりに歳をとった姿をしている。
sen.e: Although it is said to be 16 years old, it looks aged.
Although it is said to be 16 years old, it looks aged.
Although it is said to be 16 years old, it looks aged.

sen.j: 仁王門 - 1891年（明治24年）焼失し、1911年（明治44年）再建された。
sen.e: Nio-mon was burned down in Year 1891, and rebuilt in Year 1911.
Nio-mon was burned down in 1891, and rebuilt in 1911.
Nio-mon was burned down in 1891, and rebuilt in 1911.

sen.j: 山門駅から多宝塔駅までのケーブルカーは1957年（昭和32年）に開通している。
sen.e: The cable car from Sanmon Station to Tahoto Station started operations in Year 1957.
The cable car from Sanmon Station to Tahoto Station started operating in 1957.
sen.cmt: operations を operating に変更
sen.e: The cable car from Sanmon Station to Tahoto Station started operating in 1957.

sen.j: 多宝塔 - 1959年（昭和34年）再建。
sen.e: Tahoto was rebuilt in Year 1959.
Tahoto was rebuilt in 1959.
Tahoto was rebuilt in 1959.

sen.j: 本殿金堂 - 1971年再建
sen.e: Great Hall was rebult in Year 1971.
Great Hall was rebult in 1971.
Great Hall was rebuilt in Year 1971.

sen.j: 寝殿 - 1924年（大正13年）の建築。
sen.e: Shinden was built in Year 1924.
Shinden was built in 1924.
Shinden was built in 1924.

sen.j: 転法輪堂 - 1969年（昭和44年）再建。
sen.e: Tenhorindo Hall was rebuilt in Year 1969.
Tenhorindo Hall was rebuilt in 1969.
Tenhorindo Hall was rebuilt in 1969.

sen.j: 奥の院魔王殿 - 本殿から西の貴船神社へ抜ける山道の途中、奇岩の上にある小堂。
sen.e: Mao-den of penetralia, is a small shrine on top of a strange rock which is located on a mountain road on the way from the Main Shrine to Kibune Shrine in the West.
Mao-den of penetralia is a small shrine on top of a oddly-shaped rock located on a mountain road on the way from the Main Shrine to Kibune Shrine in the West.
sen.cmt: strange rock を oddly-shaped rock に変更
sen.e: Mao-den of penetralia is a small shrine on top of a oddly-shaped rock located on a mountain road on the way from the Main Shrine to Kibune Shrine in the West.

sen.j: 650万年前に金星から地球に降り立ったという魔王尊を祀っている。
sen.e: It enshrines Maoson, which is said to have arrived to Earth from Venus 6.5 million years ago.
It enshrines Maoson, which is said to have arrived on Earth from Venus 6.5 million years ago.
It enshrines Maoson, which is said to have arrived on Earth from Venus 6.5 million years ago.

sen.j: 現在の建物は1945年（昭和20年）の焼失後の再建。
sen.e: The current building was rebuilt after being burnt down in Year 1945.
The current building was rebuilt after being burnt down in 1945.
The current building was rebuilt after being burnt down in 1945.

sen.j: 霊宝殿 - 本殿裏にある。
sen.e: Reihoden Hall is located at the back of the Main Shrine.
Reihoden Hall is located at the back of the Main Shrine.
Reihoden Hall is located at the back of the Main Shrine.

sen.j: 1階は鞍馬山自然博物苑で、鞍馬山の動植物に関する展示がある。
sen.e: On the 1st Floor there is Kuramayama Museum, which has an exhibition of the animals and plants of Mount Kurama.
On the 1st Floor there is Kuramayama Museum, which has an exhibition of the animals and plants of Mount Kurama.
On the 1st Floor there is Kuramayama Museum, which has an exhibition of the animals and plants of Mount Kurama.

sen.j: 2階は寺宝展示室と与謝野鉄幹・与謝野晶子の遺品等を展示した、与謝野記念室がある（鞍馬弘教を開宗した信楽香雲は与謝野門下の歌人であった）。
sen.e: On the 2nd Floor, there are Temple Treasure Exhibit Room, and Yosano Memorial Hall, which exhibits articles, etc. left by Tekkan YOSANO and Akiko YOSANO (Koun SHIGARAKI, who started Kurama-kokyo Sect, was a poet who studied under the YOSANO's).

The 2nd Floor houses Temple Treasure Exhibit Room and Yosano Memorial Hall, which exhibits articles, and other items left by Tekkan YOSANO and Akiko YOSANO (Koun SHIGARAKI, who started Kurama-kokyo Sect, was a poet who studied under the YOSANO's).

The 2nd Floor houses Temple Treasure Exhibit Room and Yosano Memorial Hall, which exhibits articles, and other items left by Tekkan YOSANO and Akiko YOSANO (Koun SHIGARAKI, who started Kurama-kokyo Sect, was a poet who studied under the YOSANO's).

sen.j: 3階は仏像奉安室で、国宝の木造毘沙門天立像、木造吉祥天立像、木造善膩師童子（ぜんにしどうじ）立像の三尊像をはじめとする文化財が展示されている。
sen.e: On the 3rd Floor there is a sanctuary of Buddhist statues, which exhibits cultural properties including the 3 statues, Wooden statue of Bishamonten, Wooden statue of Kosshouten, and Wooden statue of Zennishi-doji.
sen.cmt: Zennishi-doji にも、他の２つと等しくなるように "statue of"を加えた。
sen.e: On the 3rd Floor there is a sanctuary of Buddhist statues, which exhibits cultural properties including three standing statues: Wooden statue of Bishamonten, Wooden statue of Kosshouten, and Wooden statue of Zennishi-doji.
sen.cmt: 立像の訳に standing を追加
sen.e: On the 3rd Floor there is a sanctuary of Buddhist statues, which exhibits cultural properties including three standing statues: Wooden statue of Bishamonten, Wooden statue of Kosshouten, and Wooden statue of Zennishi-doji.

sen.j: 鞍馬寺の本尊はこの毘沙門天の三尊像であったとする説や、同じく霊宝館に安置されている平安時代後期の重要文化財兜跋毘沙門天（とばつびしゃもんてん）の姿と近いものでなかったかとする説もある。
sen.e: There is a view that the Honzon of Kurama Temple were such 3 statues of Bishamonten, and also a view that the Honzon probably looked similar to the Tobatsu-Bishamonten of latter half of Heian era, which is an Important Cultural Property, and also enshrined in Reihoden Hall.

There is a view that the Honzon of Kurama-dera Temple were these three statues of Bishamonten, and there is another view that the Honzon probably looked similar to the Tobatsu-Bishamonten of the latter half of Heian era, which is an Important Cultural Property; this statue is also enshrined in Reihoden Hall.

There is a view that the Honzon of Kurama-dera Temple were these three statues of Bishamonten, and there is another view that the Honzon probably looked similar to the Tobatsu-Bishamonten of the latter half of Heian era, which is an Important Cultural Property; this statue is also enshrined in Reihoden Hall.

sen.j: 平安時代中期以降の末法思想から生み出された経塚遺跡からの発掘品も見ることができる。
sen.e: Articles born from the idea of the Latter Day of the Law, and which have been excavated from Ruin of Kyozuka, can also be seen here.
Articles excavated from the Ruin of Kyozuka, which are items born from the idea of the Latter Day of the Law during the latter half of the Heian period, can also be seen here.
Articles excavated from the Ruin of Kyozuka, which are items born from the idea of the Latter Day of the Law during the latter half of the Heian period can also be seen here.

sen.j: なお、霊宝殿前には与謝野晶子の書斎「冬柏亭」が移築されている。
sen.e: Also, Akiko YOSANO's library, named "Tohaku-tei", has been moved from its original location and reconstructed in front of Reihoden Hall.
Also, Akiko YOSANO's library, named "Tohaku-tei", has been moved from its original location and reconstructed in front of Reihoden Hall.
Also, Akiko YOSANO's library, named "Tohaku-tei", has been moved from its original location and reconstructed in front of Reihoden Hall.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄出町柳駅から叡山電鉄鞍馬線に乗ると約30分で鞍馬駅に着く。
sen.e: From Demachiyanagi Station of Eizan Electric Railway, Kurama Line, it takes approximately 30 minutes to arrive at Kurama Station.
From Demachiyanagi Station of Eizan Electric Railway, Kurama Line, it takes approximately 30 minutes to arrive at Kurama Station.

sen.j: 駅を出て徒歩1分で仁王門（山門）に至る。
sen.e: It takes 1 minute by foot to go from the station to Nio-mon (Main Gate).
It takes 1 minute by foot to go from the station to Nio-mon (Main Gate).

sen.j: 一部石畳だが基本的に未舗装の山道である。

sen.j: 徒歩での参拝は、高齢者などには大変なため、仁王門から多宝塔の間にケーブルカー（鞍馬山鋼索鉄道）を運行している。
sen.e: As it is hard to visit and worship on foot for such people as the aged, cable car (Mount Kurama Cable Raiway) is operating between Nio-mon and Two-storied Pagota.
Because it is hard to visit and worship on foot for the elderly people, cable car (Mount Kurama Cable Raiway) is operates between Nio-mon and Two-storied Pagota.
Because it is hard to visit and worship on foot for the elderly people, cable car (Mount Kurama Cable Railway) is operates between Nio-mon and Two-storied Pagoda.

sen.j: 乗車時間は2分ほどの距離だが、寺に100円の寄付金を納めた人が無料で乗車できる（事実上、運賃が片道100円）。
sen.e: The time spent in the cable car is only about ２ minutes, and a person who contributes 100 yen to the temple can ride the cable car (essentially 100 yen fare one way).
The time spent in the cable car is only about ２ minutes, and those who contribute 100 yen to the temple can ride the cable car for free (essentially, the fare is 100 yen one way).
The time spent in the cable car is only about 2 minutes, and those who contribute 100 yen to the temple can ride the cable car for free (essentially, the fare is 100 yen one way).

sen.j: 多宝塔から本殿金堂までは10分ほどの石畳を歩く。
sen.e: From the Two-storied Pagota to Main Shrine Golden Hall, you need to walk about 10 minutes on a stone paved road.
From the Two-storied Pagota to Main Shrine Golden Hall, it is about a 10 minute walk on a stone paved road.
From the Two-storied Pagoda to Main Shrine Golden Hall, you need to walk about 10 minutes on a stone paved road.

sen.j: 徒歩での参拝の場合は由岐神社を経由する。
sen.e: If you are visting and worshipping on foot, you need to go via Yuki Shrine.
Visting and worshipping on foot will take you via Yuki Shrine.
sen.cmt: trans1 では強制的に由岐神社に参拝しなくてはいけないようなかんじがするので書き替えました
sen.e: If you are visiting and worshipping on foot, you need to go via Yuki Shrine.

sen.j: なお、寺側は歩くことが可能な人は、ケーブルカーを使わずに徒歩で参拝することを勧めている。
sen.e: The temple encourages people who can walk the distance, not to use the cable car and visit and worship the temple on foot.
The temple encourages people who can walk the distance, not to use the cable car and visit and worship the temple on foot.
The temple encourages people who can walk the distance, not to use the cable car and visit and worship the temple on foot.

sen.j: 貴船側からのアクセス
sen.e: Access from Kibune side
Access from Kibune side
Access from Kibune side
Kibune Shrine (35) - 573m - Mao-den (185) - 460m - Sekurabe ishi(235) - 404m - Main Shrine Golden Hall(160)
Kibune Shrine (35) - 573m - Mao-den (185) - 460m - Sekurabe ishi(235) - 404m - Main Shrine Golden Hall(160)
Kibune Shrine (35) - 573m - Mao-den (185) - 460m - Sekurabe ishi(235) - 404m - Main Shrine Golden Hall(160)

sen.j: 括弧内の数字は仁王門の高さを基準とした標高差（単位m）
sen.e: The numbers in brackets are differences in altitudes based on the height of Nio-mon (unit: m).
sen.cmt: 他では仁王門の標高なのに、ここでは高さとなっているが、そのまま訳した。
sen.e: The numbers in brackets are altitudes measurements based on that of Nio-mon (unit: m).
sen.cmt: 原文の直訳ではなくなるが、読みやすいように変更
sen.e: The numbers in brackets are altitudes measurements based on that of Nio-mon (unit: m).

sen.j: 貴船からの入り口は西門と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The entrance from Kibune side is called Nishi-mon.
The entrance from Kibune side is called Nishi-mon.
The entrance from Kibune side is called Nishi-mon.

sen.j: このルートはかつて牛若丸が天狗との修行で走った道とされている。
sen.e: This route is said to be the route that Ushiwakamaru ran, when he practiced with Tengu.
This route is said to be the route that Ushiwakamaru ran, when he trained with Tengu.
sen.cmt: practiced から trained に変更
sen.e: This route is said to be the route that Ushiwakamaru ran, when he trained with Tengu.

sen.j: 山をひとつ越えることになるので鞍馬側から登るより大変である。
sen.e: As you will be crossing one mountain, it will be harder than climbing from the Kurama side.
As you will be crossing one mountain, it will be harder than climbing from the Kurama side.
As you will be crossing one mountain, it will be harder than climbing from the Kurama side.

sen.j: 成人男性でも50分ほどかかる。
sen.e: It will take about 50 minutes on foot, even for a grown man.
It will take about 50 minutes on foot, even for a grown man.
It will take about 50 minutes on foot, even for a grown man.
